text: Has anyone else had issues where they try to update content in a custom module on a page/email and it just doesn't respond? I've seen this on two accounts now and these are modules that worked perfectly fine up until the last few days and still work fine in other areas. Clicking on Apply here does nothing.

HubSpot Support just replied with "it's not populating the src" but it should be and is on the other tile on the right-hand side above, for example. The modules appear in red in the modules section :S Is it because I updated them after they were added to the page or something?
Do you have a preview link that I could check out? Feel free to PM me so I can take a closer look.
Thanks! I just sent you a message and appreciate you looking into it :slightly_smiling_face:
Ditto, feel free to send a link to me as well. I work on the editor at HubSpot.
Thanks <@UA886MF42>! Jason took a look into it and opened an issue with the Product team and there is a workaround so I think we're good for now.

Hello!

I don't understand why my advance menu module isn't working.... here's my code:
```{% menu "blog_nav" site_map_name='ressources-center', overrideable=True, label='Advanced Menu' %}```

I can't select a menu in the dropdown menu.

Here's a video of what is happening: <https://drive.google.com/file/d/166iHq1QM9vRblG_la4lQ08h8XPRCO4KC/view>
check for JS errors in the console
Is it possible the site_map_name is misspelled? ressources -> resources EDIT: nvm - french spelling :stuck_out_tongue:
<@UDU6KEBFB> You published the menu?
ressources is french yes. it's ok like this.
site_map_name='ressources-center' is to set the default
the default appear like it should
But I can't select anothe menu eventhough I set overrideable=True
yes it is published.. none of the menus can be selected
Got it now.

I have a tag + author listing page that pulls from multiple blogs. I'm using the same template to separate content from another language using {% if content.slug is string_startingwith "en-gb" %}. This works on Pages but not the listing template. Does anyone know if content.slug is the correct variable for a tag + author listing page?
Maybe try use {{ content|pprint }} on the listing template and confirm the property to use?
ok, thanks
<@UDARG2NKZ> that didn't work exactly but I did figure it out. I substituted request.path for content.slug and it worked.
:thumbsup:
